title: Mick Cleary's verdict: England slay demons of 2015 with imperfect victory over 14-man Argentina - but how many more head-high hits can Farrell take?
text:
Onwards go England, into the World Cup quarter-finals, slaying those demons of 2015 in a performance that was imperfect and ragged at times but on the money when it came to claiming a third consecutive bonus point by the 45th minute, even if the red card shown to Pumas lock Tomas Lavanini hugely aided their cause.

Such was the trauma of four years ago with pool-stage elimination, and the fall-out it precipitated, it is only right to acknowledge the deed with one pool match to play, against France in Yokohama on Saturday. A quarter-final against Australia in Oita is shaping up.

As for the tens of thousands of England fans sweltering from the heat and swooning from the prospect of what might lie...
description: Onwards go England, into the World Cup quarter-finals, slaying those demons of 2015 in a performance that was imperfect and ragged at times but on the money when it came to claiming a third consecutive bonus point by the 45th minute, even if the red card shown to Pumas lock Tomas Lavanini hugely aided their cause.
